subject_description: Zero-UI temporal companion overlaying history onto physical Zurich. Full-duplex multimodal AI using MiniCPM-o 4.5, Qwen3-VL spatial grounding, and generative world engine for unscripted historical roleplay. Voice-first, proactive landmark identification, 4-layer spatial audio, on-device privacy. Version 5.0 - Post-Freedom Design.
executive_summary: Mirari V5.0 is the most technically coherent and emotionally resonant project in the portfolio — a historical companion that speaks when it sees something interesting, generates personalized souvenirs of your walk, and lets you argue with Zwingli is genuinely compelling. The vision is right for 2026 and aligns with Vimo's strengths. But the submission conflates product quality with product discovery, and the financial projections assume a discovery mechanism that doesn't yet exist. Three validation gates must be cleared before build can begin: tourist WTP intercept test, hotel distribution commitment (not revenue — distribution), and architectural revision to GPS-first/cloud-conversation model. The council is not rejecting Mirari — it is saying the work to be done is in the real world, not in the product specification.
key_insight: Distribution is a launch requirement, not a growth-phase activity. Every tourist who uses Mirari will have been placed there by a hotel key card, a Zürich Tourismus recommendation, or a viral travel vlogger video — not organic App Store discovery. The submission plans hotel partnerships as revenue streams; they are actually the primary distribution channel and must be secured before build begins.

dimension_scores.reasoning: Real market with genuine white space — no competitor currently offers generative, proactive, zero-UI historical roleplay tied to physical location. Concern: conversion assumptions are 3-5x optimistic. Realistic cold-start conversion is 5-7% vs. 12% projected. Tourism timing window (2.3 nights average stay) creates freemium mechanic misalignment.

Achievable with revised architecture, not as currently described. Simultaneous 4-model on-device stack (MiniCPM-o 4.5 + Qwen3-VL + MobileLLM-Pro P1 + NeuTTS-Nano) will cause thermal throttling within 8-10 minutes under real-world conditions, not the 15-minute target. Required fix: GPS-first trigger, cloud-conversation model, on-device only for activation — adds 3-4 weeks but solves thermal and hallucination risk simultaneously.

Unit economics are actually healthy (CHF 3.04/month contribution margin at 61%). The problem is volume: at realistic 5% cold-start conversion, Year 1 revenue is CHF 21K against CHF 43K costs — a CHF 22K hole. CHF 9.99 one-time city pass deserves serious evaluation over subscription. Digital Souvenir should move from Pro add-on to free viral mechanic. iOS dev budget (CHF 18K) is 40-60% below Zürich market rate.

Primary execution risk is distribution failure, not technical failure. Historical hallucination without RAG grounding is a reputational risk that must be addressed before launch. Zürich Tourismus procurement cycle (6-12 months) should not appear in Year 1 financial projections.

Genuine white space. True moat is quality of Character Constitutions and conversational coherence — harder to replicate than historian research alone. Window before Google/Apple absorbs this: 18-36 months. Move now or lose the timing advantage.
2026 is the right moment. First year that on-device multimodal AI (MiniCPM-o class) makes this experience viable. The inflection point is now.

evaluations.key_finding: Genuine white space, but conversion funnel is strained. Realistic install-to-paid funnel: 351K potential × 5% aware × 30% download × 10% convert = ~5,200 paid users, not 52K projected.
evaluations.biggest_risk: Discovery channel. Tourists don't browse App Stores for city-specific AI apps. Without hotel partnerships or Zürich Tourismus placement on day one, organic discovery will be near-zero.

evaluations.biggest_risk: Tourist abandonment within first 5 minutes because Zero-UI experience reads as broken. Onboarding calibration is critical.

evaluations.biggest_risk: 12% conversion assumption. At realistic 5% cold-start, Year 1 is a CHF 22K loss.

risks: Distribution failure: organic App Store discovery will produce <200 downloads/month without hotel/tourism board partnerships from day one
Historical hallucination: without RAG grounding, Claude will confidently state false historical facts — reputational risk at scale
Thermal throttling: always-on 4-model stack achieves 8-10 minutes before throttling, not the 15-minute target
Conversion miss: at 5% cold-start (vs. 12% assumed), Year 1 is a CHF 22K loss, not break-even
First-use abandonment: Zero-UI experience reads as 'app broken' without 20-second audio calibration intro
Tourist trust gap: unsolicited AI voice narration in a foreign city may feel disorienting rather than magical — requires Wizard of Oz validation
open_questions: Do tourists who experience a 60-second demo express genuine WTP — and at which price point (CHF 4.99/month vs. CHF 9.99 one-time city pass)?
Will tourists find the proactive, zero-UI voice interruptions magical or disorienting in Zürich's quiet urban environment?
Can a boutique hotel partnership be secured before build begins, confirming that B2B distribution is a viable launch channel?
Is CHF 18K sufficient for iOS development in Zürich, or should the build be offshored to reduce cost?
consensus_areas: The product vision is genuinely compelling and differentiable
2026 timing is right — on-device AI inflection point
Hotel QR distribution is the critical path, not App Store
The architecture needs revision: GPS-first, cloud conversation, on-device trigger only
Do not build until Wizard of Oz WTP test is complete
disagreement_areas: Pricing model: monthly subscription vs. one-time city pass — council split on which aligns better with tourist psychology
India market: no consensus on relevance for v1.0 (flagged for Year 3 expansion only)
synthesized_reasoning: Mirari V5.0 earns a 'needs-info' verdict not because the idea is weak, but because the two most critical unknowns — tourist WTP and hotel distribution viability — are 2-week field tests, not 6-month builds. The technical architecture has a fixable flaw (thermal + hallucination risk solved by GPS-first + RAG). The business model has a solvable gap (Digital Souvenir as free tier, city pass pricing evaluation). Run the intercept test first. If 12+ of 20 tourists express genuine WTP, the council expects to score this 6.8-7.2 on resubmission and recommend PROCEED.
